intro: Carex langyaensis, commonly known as the Langya sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes grass-like plants commonly found in wet or moist environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters. It typically grows in shaded, damp areas such as forest floors or wetlands. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
